quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correct regarding the concept of Social Justice?

  1. Social justice is based on the values of fairness, equality, respect for diversity, access to social protection, and the application of human rights in all spheres of life.
  2. Social Justice is advanced when we remove barriers that people face because of gender, age, race, ethnicity, religion, culture, or disability.
  3. 20th February is proclaimed as the World Day of Social Justice by the United Nations General Assembly.
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1,2 and 3
None of the  above

quiz.text: Which of the following constitutional provisions relating to Positive discrimination in favor of the underprivileged is/are incorrectly matched?
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
3 and 4 only
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correct regarding constitutional provisions with regard to the welfare of Scheduled Castes and Tribes under Constitutional Provisions in India?

  1. Under Part IX relating to the Panchayats and Part IXA of the Constitution relating to the Municipalities, reservation for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in local bodies has been envisaged and provided.
  2. Article 338 provides for a National Commission for the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes with duties to investigate and monitor all matters relating to safeguards provided for them.
  3. Scheduled Castes are notified as per provisions contained in Article 341 of the Constitution.
options: 1 and  2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and  3 only
1,2 and  3
None of the  above

quiz.text: Which of the following is not one of the three components of Accessible India Campaign?
options: Built Environment Accessibility
Transportation System Accessibility
Clean Energy Accessibility
Information and Communication Eco-System Accessibility
None of the  above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correct regarding Scheduled Tribes in India?

  1. Article 342 prescribes procedures to be followed in the matter of specification of scheduled tribes.
  2. The first specification of Scheduled Tribes in relation to a particular State/Union Territory is by a notified order of the President, after consultation with the State governments concerned.
  3. Parliament may by law include in or exclude from the list of Scheduled tribes specified in a notification issued by the President.
  4. Criteria for recognizing any community as scheduled Tribe is expressly spelled out in the constitution.
options: 2, 3  and  4
1, 2 and 3
1, 2 and  4
1, 3 and  4
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding the Sankalp Platform for Pensioners?
options: Sankalp is a project to channelize the skill, experience and time available with Central Government Pensioners into meaningful social intervention
It is an initiative of the Department of Pension & Pensioners' Welfare under Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
At present only Central Government Civil Pensioners, Defence Civilians and Defence Retirees are eligible for registration under SANKALP
It also facilitates the organizations working in these areas to select appropriate skill and expertise from the available pool of volunteer pensioners
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correctly matched?

Sl.No.

Scheme

Key Feature(s)

1.

Padho Pradesh

Providing 'interest subsidy' for minority students for overseas studies

2.

Nalanda Scheme

Innovative Faculty Development Program of Union Ministry of Minority Affairs

3.

Jiyo Parsi

Central Sector Scheme for containing population decline of Parsis
options: 1 and  2 only
2 and  3 only
1 and 3 only
1,2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correct regarding Vanbandhu Kalyan Yojana?

  1. The Government of India, Ministry of Social Justice has launched the Vanbandhu Kalyan Yojana (VKY) for the welfare of Tribals.
  2. It aims at creating enabling environment for need-based and outcome-oriented holistic development of the tribal people.
  3. It covers all tribal people and all areas with tribal populations across the country.
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1,2 and 3
None of the  above

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding Scheme for Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups (PVTGs)?
options: It came into effect from April 1,2008
It defines PVTGs as the most vulnerable among the Scheduled Castes
It identifies 75 PVTGs

It adopts a holistic approach to the socio-economic development of PVTGs and gives state governments flexibility in planning initiatives that are geared towards the specific socio-cultural imperatives of the specific groups at hand
None of the  above

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding Stand up India Scheme?
options: It aims at promoting entrepreneurship among women and scheduled castes and tribes
The scheme is anchored by Department of Financial Services (DFS), Ministry of Finance, Government of India.
SC/ST and/or woman entrepreneurs, above 18 years of age are eligible beneficaries under the scheme
Loan under the scheme is available for only green field project
None of the  above

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Amendment Act, 2015?
options: It seeks to ensure more stringent provisions for prevention of Atrocities against Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes.
Assaulting or sexual exploiting an SC or ST woman is an offence under the Act
The Act specifies that a non SC or ST public servant who neglects his/her duties relating to SCs or STs shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term of six months to one year

Under the provisions of the act, the court shall presume that the accused was aware of the caste or tribal identity of the victim if the accused had personal knowledge of the victim or his family and the burden of proof lies on SC/ST victim.
None of the  above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correct regarding Protection of Civil Rights Act, 1955?

1. It has been enacted in pursuance of Article 21 of the Constitution of India and provides for abolition of untouchability.

2. The act extends to the whole of India

3. It is implemented by the respective State Governments and Union Territory Administrations.
options: 1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
1,2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correct in respect of various Constitutional and legislative provisions for the welfare of persons with disability?

  1. The Constitution in the schedule of subjects lays direct responsibility for the empowerment of disabled persons on the Union government.
  2. The Persons with Disabilities (Equal Opportunities, Protection of Rights and Full Participation) Act, 1995’ has been enacted to ensure equal opportunities for persons with disabilities and their full participation in nation-building.
  3. The Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, ministry of minority affairs was set up with the sole purpose of welfare of persons with disability.
options: 1,2 and 3
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1 and 2 only
Only 2

quiz.text:
To which of the following conventions/declarations on the welfare of Persons with Disability India is not a signatory?

  1.  ‘Declaration on the Full Participation and Equality of People' with Disabilities in the Asia-Pacific Region
  2. Biwako Millennium Framework
  3. UN Convention on Protection and Promotion of the Rights and Dignity of Persons with Disabilities
options: 1 only
2 only
3 only
1,2 & 3
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following areas is not covered under Schedule VI of the constitution?
options: Assam
Meghalaya
Tripura
Arunachal Pradesh
Mizoram

quiz.text:
In which of the following Indian states / Union Territories there is no population of Scheduled Tribes?

1. Punjab

2. Haryana

3. Chandigarh

4. Puducherry
options: 1,2 and  3 only
2,3 and 4 only
1,3 and 4 only
1,2,3 and 4
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correct regarding Article 16 of the Indian Constitution?

  1. It provides for equality of opportunity for all citizens in matters relating to employment or appointment to any office under the State.
  2. Nothing in this Article shall prevent the State from making any provision for the reservation of appointments or posts in favour of any backward class of citizens.
  3. In Indira Sawhney case the majority bench of the Supreme Court pointed out that Article 16 spoke of adequate representation and not proportionate representation.
  4. In the Mandal commission case, the Supreme Court has clearly and authoritatively laid down that the “creamy layer” has to be excluded from the backward class and the benefit of reservation under Article 16.
options: 1,2 and  3 only
2,3 and  4 only
1,3 and 4 only
1,2,3 and 4
None of the above

quiz.text: How many seats in the Lok Sabha are reserved for Scheduled Tribes?
options: 47
29
34
57
57

quiz.text: Which of the following schemes is not under the ambit of Ministry of Minority Affairs?
options: Seekho aur Kamao
New Swarnima
Padho Pardesh
Nai Roshni
Nai Manzil

quiz.text: Which Article of the Indian Constitution provides protection to Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes for Social Justice and all forms of exploitation?
options: Article - 41
Article - 45
Article - 46
Article - 343
Article 50

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding Varishta Pension Bima Yojana?
options: It is a scheme for the benefit of senior citizens aged 60 years and above.
The scheme is being administered through State Bank of India (SBI).
The Scheme will provide social security during old age and protect elderly persons against a future fall in their interest income.
It will provide an assured pension based on a guaranteed rate of return of 8% per annum for ten years.
None of the  above

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding Jeevan Praman Scheme?
options: Jeevan Pramaan is a biometric enabled digital service for pensioners
The scheme was launched in 2017
The beneficiaries of the scheme are over a crore retired employees of government and PSUs.
Using Jeevan Pramaan, a pensioner can now digitally provide proof of his/her existence to authorities for continuity of pension every year.
None of the  above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is correct regarding National Policy on Senior Citizens 2011?

  1. According to the policy, all those of 65 years and above are senior citizens.
  2. The policy addresses issues concerning senior citizens living in urban and rural areas, special needs of the oldest of old and older women.
  3. The foundational factors of the policy include demographic explosion among the elderly, the changing economy and social milieu, advancement in medical research, science and technology and high levels of destitution among the elderly rural poor
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1,2 and 3
None of the  above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correct regarding the Maintenance and Welfare of Parents and Senior Citizens Act, 2007?

  1. A senior citizen including a parent who is unable to maintain himself from his own earnings or property owned by him, shall be entitled to make an application under the provisions of the act.
  2. No application can be made against the relative of childless senior citizens for support.
  3. Under the provisions of the act, the obligation of the children to maintain his or her parents extends to the needs of such parent either father or mother or both, as the case may be, so that such parent may lead a normal life.
options: 1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
1,2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is not a constitutional provision related to Social Justice?
options: Equal justice and free legal aid
Reservation for SC and ST in Legislature
Equal pay for equal work
Prohibition of Child labor
Abolition of Untouchability

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding the Rights of Persons With Disabilities (RPWD) Act, 2016?
options: According to the Act any person who “intentionally insults or intimidates with intent to humiliate a person with a disability in any place within public view” is punishable with imprisonment.
It provides that 4% of all vacancies in the government organizations will be reserved for disabled people
This act proposes that every child with disability gets free education from the age of 6 to 14
Number of types of disabilities have been increased from 7 to 21.
None of the above

quiz.text: Which Article of the Constitution provides for a social order based on justice?
options: Article 39
Article 38
Article 40
Article 45
Article 42

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding Nai Manzil Scheme?
options: The scheme aims to benefit the minority youths who are school-dropouts or educated in the community education institutions
The youths in the age group of 14 to 18 years will be eligible beneficaries
It aims at providing formal education (up till Class VIII or X) and skill training along with certification to the target youth
Minimum 30% seats under the scheme are earmarked for minority girls
None of the  above

quiz.text: Which of the following schemes aims to preserve rich heritage of minority communities in context of Indian culture?
options: Nai Manzil
Hamari Darohar
Ek Bharat Shresth Bharat
Eklavya
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are incorrect regarding USTAAD scheme?

1. The Scheme aims at upgrading Skills and Training in preservation of traditional Ancestral Arts/Crafts of scheduled castes and tribes.

2. It envisages boosting the skill of craftsmen, weavers and artisans who are already engaged in the traditional ancestral work.

3. It is fully funded by Union Government and Union Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment is nodal agency in implementing it.
options: 1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
2 only
All of the above

quiz.text:
Scheduled castes are those castes/races in the country that suffer from extreme social, educational and economic backwardness arising out of age-old practice of untouchability and certain others on account of lack of infrastructure facilities and geographical isolation, and who need special consideration for safeguarding their interests and for their accelerated socio-economic development. Various scholarships are provided to the students belonging to the Scheduled Castes (SCs) to ensure that education is not denied due to the poor financial condition of their families. At the same time several schemes of the govt. provide financial support to Schedules Castes.

Which of the following is incorrect regarding National Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (NSFDC)?
options: It was setup in 1989
It works as a non-profit company under Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India
It has been assigned the task for financing, facilitating and mobilizing funds for the economic empowerment of persons living just above the Poverty Line
It provides financial assistance for income generating schemes for the target group through state Channelizing Agencies (SCAs) which are nominated by respective State/UT Government.
None of the  above

quiz.text: Sugamya Bharat Abhiyan is associated with
options: Disabled Persons
Child Health Care
Women Empowerment
Under Privileged People
Welfare of SC and ST

quiz.text: National Commission of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes have been replaced by the National Commission of Scheduled Castes and National Commission of Scheduled Tribes by which of the following amendment?
options: 37th Amendment
88th Amendment
89th Amendment
92nd Amendment
None of the  above

quiz.text: Under the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes [Prevention of Atrocities] Act, 1989, in which Section there is a provision for the arrangement of a Special Court?
options: 14
17
21 (1)
21 (3)
15

quiz.text:
With regard to the Sixth Schedule of the Constitution, consider the following statements
  1. The Governor is empowered to organize and re-organize the autonomous districts
  2. Each autonomous district has a district council consisting of both elected and nominated members
Which of the above statement[s] is/are correct?
options: 1 only
2 only
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
Any of the above

quiz.text: The Government enacted the Panchayat Extension to Scheduled Areas (PESA) Act in 1996. Which one of the following is not identified as its objective?
options: Provide self-rule for the bulk of the tribal population
Safeguard and preserve the traditions and customs of tribal communities
To create autonomous regions in tribal areas
Prevent panchayats at the higher level from assuming the powers and authority of panchayats at the lower level of the gram sabha
Extend the provisions of Part IX of the Constitution relating to the panchayats to the scheduled areas with certain modifications

quiz.text: Reservation for the Scheduled Casted and Scheduled tribes in the Service has been provided in the Indian Constitution under:
options: Article - 365
Article - 375
Article - 315
Article - 335
Article 338

quiz.text: The International Day of Persons with Disabilities is celebrated on?
options: 10th December
24th October
19th November
3rd December
None of the above

quiz.text: The concept of 'Reservation of seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in the House of the People' is highlighted in Article of the Constitution of India.
options: 345
326
330
361
315

quiz.text: Which of the following is NOT a feature of caste system in India ?
options: Caste is determined by birth
Caste groups are endogamous
Caste groups are exogamous
Caste system is Hierarchal
Caste System follows fixed Occupations

quiz.text:
The Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities in the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment facilitates the empowerment of the persons with disabilities, who as per Census 2011 are 2.68 crores and are 2.21 percent of the total population of the Country. These include persons with Seeing, Hearing, Speech, Movement, Mental Retardation, Mental Illness, Multiple Disabilities, and any other disabilities. At the same time, govt. from time to time launches various schemes for the welfare of the disabled.

Which of the following is/are correct regarding the Accessible India Campaign?

  1. It is popularly known as Sugamya Bharat Abhiyan
  2. It was conceptualized by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (DEPwD), Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment
  3. It is a nationwide flagship campaign for achieving universal accessibility that will enable persons with disabilities to gain access to equal opportunity and live independently and participate fully in all aspects of life
  4. The campaign targets at enhancing the accessibility of the built environment, transport system, and information & communication eco-system.
options: 1,2 and  3 only
2,3 and 4 only
1,3 and 4
1,2,3 and 4
None of the above

quiz.text:
The Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities in the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment facilitates empowerment of the persons with disabilities, who as per Census 2011 are 2.68 crore and are 2.21 percent of the total population of the Country. These include persons with Seeing,Hearing, Speech, Movement,Mental Retardation, Mental Illness, Multiple Disability and any other disabilities. At the same time, govt. from time to time launches various schemes for welfare of the disabled.

Which of the following is incorrect regarding proposed milestones of Sugamya Bharat Abhiyan?
options: At least 10% of all the government buildings of National Capital and all the State capitals will be made fully accessible for persons with disabilities by July 2019.
Conducting audit of 50% of government buildings and converting them into fully accessible buildings in 10 most important cities / towns of all the States by July 2019
Conducting accessibility audit of all the domestic airports and converting them into fully accessible airports by March 2018
Ensuring that at least 50% of all public documents issued by the Central Government and the State Governments meet accessibility standards by March 2018
None of the above

quiz.text:
The Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities in the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment facilitates the empowerment of the persons with disabilities, who as per Census 2011 are 2.68 crores and are 2.21 percent of the total population of the Country. These include persons with Seeing, Hearing, Speech, Movement, Mental Retardation, Mental Illness, Multiple Disabilities, and any other disabilities. At the same time, govt. from time to time launches various schemes for the welfare of the disabled.

Q. Inclusiveness and Accessibility Index has been launched by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (DEPwD), Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, GoI in collaboration with:
options: Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI)
All India Association of Industries (AIAI)
Confederation of Indian Industry (CII)
Associated Chambers of Commerce and Industry of India (ASSOCHAM)
None of the options given above

quiz.text: Which of the following has formulated a scheme "SMILE - Support for Marginalized Individuals for Livelihood and Enterprise"?
options: NITI Aayog
Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
Food Corporation of India
Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution

quiz.text: Consider the following statement about "Sansad Adarsh Gram Yojana" (SAGY), which of the statement is not correct?
options: Introduced in September, 2016
The goal is to develop three Adarsh Grams by March 2019
The 'Adarsh Grams' is to become schools of local development and governance, inspiring other Gram Panchayats.
Under the program, each Member of Parliament adopts a Gram Panchayat
None of the above
